DataElement.preferredName: Blood Specimen Related Genetic Research Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator relating to consent and the related genetic research using a blood specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Specimen Related Genetic Research Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to consent and the related genetic research using a blood specimen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Related; connected or associated.:Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient's initial consent giv
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient's initial consent given for blood specimen use for genetic research on patient's cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree to submit a whole blood sample for genetic studies related to the development of side-effects to the kinds of drugs used in this study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree to allow blood samples to be collected for the purposes described here

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to keep blood sample(s) for use in future research to learn about genetics and how they relate to cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree that my blood may be used for the genetic research studies described in the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree that my blood specimen(s) may be used for the genetic research studies described in the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her blood sample(s) to be used for future genetic research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to the collection of samples for genetic research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to collection of a blood sample for use in future research related to this study

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was consent given for patient's blood to be studied to look for genetic markers that may be used to predict how a person will respond to therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to have blood sent to a COG laboratory to evaluate the genes in their blood to learn more about desmoid tumors?

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Patient Consent Ind-2 2018303v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
